results.title: Pas de deux
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren takes a look at the choreography of ballet, with cinema effects that are all you would expect from this master of improvisation in music and illustration. By exposing the same frames as many as ten times, the artist creates a multiple image of the ballerina and her partner (Margaret Mercier and Vincent Warren). A bare, black stage and back-lit figures, plus the remote, airy music of panpipes, produce a quiet and detachment similar to that of another McLaren film, “Lines”. Music by The United Folk Orchestra of Romania. (Seventeen awards, including Toronto; London; New York; Melbourne; Oscar nomination, Hollywood).

results.title: Pas de deus
results.brief_description: Documentary on Phesoza Lally, an Indian from Bombay and Parsee from the Ancient Persian Dynasty. She studied in London and Russia, virtually unknown as a ballerina. This is her story. Interesting for students of ballet.

results.title: Party – Christine Anu
results.brief_description: The third single off her debut album, Party (1995) remains Christine Anu’s biggest hit to date. On the surface, the clip seems consistent with other upbeat, pop videos of the 90s with overlaid images and montages to match the mood of the song. However, Anu cleverly incorporated her Torres Strait Islander heritage into the video with choreography that was a mix of traditional dances and modern styles, not to mention a diverse cast of extras and backup dancers.

results.title: Partnership
results.creator_credit: Gesellschaft Fur Bildende Filme, Otto Martini, Karl Gschrey and Waldemar Kuri
results.brief_description: Aid to underdeveloped countries providing food and work for millions. To achieve this end in countries such as India, Pakistan and Egypt, centuries have to be bridged. The main goal is not merely to provide financial aid and material goods but to work in partnership and material goods but to work in partnership and material goods but to work in partnership to develop natural resources and train skilled workers. Examples of projects undertaken include power stations, sugar refineries, cement factories, textile mills, and Rourkela, the largest iron and steel works in Asia.

results.title: Partners: Eastern Africa
results.brief_description: A study of how the presence of the white man in East Africa has opened up possibilities for trade and industry from white the native population of East Africa should benefit; the film stresses the importance of improved medical, agriculture, educational, and industrial facilities and methods.

results.title: Partners in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and Diane O'Connor
results.brief_description: A program which encourages the participation of teachers, students, parents and school based groups and committees in the planning and development of school curriculum. Examples of how this is happening at Mt. Clear High School, Tallangatta High School and Williamstown High School are shown. Curriculum support services are also briefly mentioned.
